description: I using it and I'm satisfied with.
summary: It is an excellent alternative to RStudio

description:
I'm used to standard R and more recently, R Studio. This thing is completely different, apparently designed for novice users of R, with a number of drop down menus with standard statistical tests, distributions etc. It was obvious that a learning curve would be involved to learn it's ins and outs, and frankly I don't have time for that, given that I know for sure that R from the console or R Studio are pretty flawless.

The first thing I did, running it under Fedora Scientific, was to test whether or not it would install CRAN packages correctly--and it did not. The thing doesn't appear to recognize that Fedora COPR is the necessary repository for R packages under Fedora.

I immediately uninstalled the thing and will uninstall and reinstall R, along with R Studio. Your mileage will vary with your patience.

Ce logiciel est beaucoup moins intuitif que tout simplement R avec le shell. Pour importer un simple fichier CSV il faut donner beaucoup de précisions sur sa structure or avec un simple read.table dans R c'est fait. J'avoue que je me suis arrêté à ce stade car je ne voulais pas perdre du temps. Bon courage.
